alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lewis; Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 08 at 9:31AM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following counties, Jefferson, Lewis and Oswego. * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A band of heavy lake effect rain will impact portions of Oswego, southern Jefferson, and western Lewis counties through this evening, before moving north across Jefferson County overnight. This band of lake effect rain may produce rainfall of 2 to 4 inches across portions of the area, with even higher local amounts if the band stalls in one location for an extended period of time. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
